title: Calories in a Jalapeño
meta_description: Discover calories in jalapeno, including macros like carbs, protein, and fat for one medium pepper, plus variations and FAQs.
assumptions: Medium raw jalapeño pepper (~14 g), green, fresh; no added ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, ripeness, variety, and preparation. Check labels for processed versions.

quick_answer.text: One medium raw jalapeño provides about 4 kcal and is low in calories but high in vitamin C.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged foods.

faqs.q: How many calories in one jalapeno?
faqs.a: About 4 kcal for a medium raw jalapeño.
Yes, one medium has ~0.9 g carbs, with 0.4 g fiber.
Varies widely; plain stuffed ones add ~50+ kcal from cheese or batter.

faqs.q: Do jalapenos have fat or protein?
faqs.a: Minimal: 0.1 g fat and 0.1 g protein per medium pepper.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in jalapeno?
faqs.a: Raw and roasted are similar at ~4 kcal; frying or oil adds significant calories.
